metadata.title: CVE-2020-25599 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. There are evtchn_reset()race conditions. Uses of EVTCHNOP_reset (potentially by a guest on itself)or XEN_DOMCTL_soft_reset (by itself covered by XSA-77) can lead to theviolation of various internal assumptions. This may lead to out of boundsmemory accesses or triggering of bug checks. In particular, x86 PV guestsmay be able to elevate their privilege to that of the host. Host and guestcrashes are also possible, leading to a Denial of Service (DoS).Information leaks cannot be ruled out. All Xen versions from 4.5 onwardsare vulnerable. Xen versions 4.4 and earlier are not vulnerable.

criterions.comment: xen package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
